intro: Conopodium glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent pod that splits open to release its seeds. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats.
